message.raw:
Fixed a corner case with module modification checking. Checking now happens once a second rather than at execute time.

This occurs in a separate thread.

Fixed a corner case with module modification checking. Checking now happens once a second rather than at execute time.

message.raw:
Modified subproc_utils' heartbeats to include a lock so that the process isn't killed whilst the lock is held (for use when writing to h5 files).

Modified lyse's subprocess to use this lock.

message.raw: Modified subproc_utils and lyse such that on windows, subprocesses don't display terminal windows.

message.raw: Fixed bug where matplotlib plots would freeze up shortly after being displayed. Turns out you can't create windows in threads other than the main thread. So now the window creation happens in a callback triggered with a gobject.idle_add()
message.html: Fixed bug where matplotlib plots would freeze up shortly after being displayed. Turns out you can't create windows in threads other than the main thread. So now the window creation happens in a callback triggered with a gobject.idle_add()

summary.raw: Fixed bug where matplotlib plots would freeze up shortly after being displayed. Turns out you can't create windows in threads other than the main thread. So now the window creation happens in a callback triggered with a gobject.idle_add()
summary.html: Fixed bug where matplotlib plots would freeze up shortly after being displayed. Turns out you can't create windows in threads other than the main thread. So now the window creation happens in a callback triggered with a gobject.idle_add()

values.message: Fixed bug where matplotlib plots would freeze up shortly after being displayed. Turns out you can't create windows in threads other than the main thread. So now the window creation happens in a callback triggered with a gobject.idle_add()

message.raw: Reverted previous change to lyse. Instead exended the interface provided by subproc_utils to allow feedback so that a server can send to its own listener (lyse uses this to shut down the listener thread in the event that the child process dies, otherwise it would block forever).
message.html: Reverted previous change to lyse. Instead exended the interface provided by subproc_utils to allow feedback so that a server can send to its own listener (lyse uses this to shut down the listener thread in the event that the child process dies, otherwise it would block forever).

message.raw: Modified analysis routine destruction method and analysis subprocess quit method to work within the limitatation that the queues connecting them are single-direction. The subprocess has to tell the main process to stop listening!

message.raw:
Auto fill run time and run number if not present in h5 file due to it being from before these attributes were implemented. Connected close button of main program to gt.main_quit.
Removed a gtk setting which seems to not exist in lab computers' version of pygtk, and doesn't matter anyway.
